messageBody:
> > > QUESTION 3:
> > How do I "turn on" my mock objects when tests are running?
>
> In our current tests we are only using mock objects for a few tests
> to mock out the database. We have one class we call that returns a
> database connection, so we added a method to that class to allow us
> to say "Hey, here's a mock object for this data source. When someone
> requests a connection to this database, give them this mock object
> instead of a real connection." This let's us mix mock objects and
> real connection. For example, we have one database that is ours, and
> we have a test replica in-house. Several other databases we deal
> with are outside our realm. So, if need be, we could still hit our
> database and mock out all of the other ones.

Aha... I like that. You have to create the mock object in
the test case (or it's setUp()), so what you do is to hand
that mock object off to the factory class. This is how the
factory knows to hand out a mock instead of a real connection.
Nice. I think I'd ALSO have the factory check an environment
variable (so I can report things like asking for 2 connections
when it was only supposed to ask for one), but this is a
good approach.

-- Michael Chermside
